xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class CrossTableCursor<D>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<Tuple>
      xxl.core.relational.cursors.CrossTableCursor<D>
Type Parameters:
D - the type of the data structure that is internally used for storing the aggregated tuples that have identical values for the columns defining the dimensions of the cross table.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class CrossTableCursor<D>
extends AbstractCursor<Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>

This class computes the cross table of an input metadata cursor. All data of the table is stored inside maps in main memory. The best way to describe the function will be an example:
the dataset

ABC
a0b0c0
a0b1c1
a1b0c2
a1b1c3
can be transformed into (first dimension is given by column "A", second dimension is given by column "B" and tuples are reduced to the value of column "C")
A\Bb0b1
a0c0c1
a1c2c3

Field Detail

aggregate

protected MetaDataFunction<? super D,? extends Object,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> aggregate
A function that maps an instance of the internally used data structure to an object representing it. The function must be able to provide relational metadata that is used as relational metadata for the columns defined by the second dimension.

Constructor Detail

CrossTableCursor

public CrossTableCursor(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor,
                        String firstDimensionColumnName,
                        String secondDimensionColumnName,
                        AggregationFunction<? super Tuple,D> tupleAggregate,
                        MetaDataFunction<? super D,? extends Object,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> aggregate,
                        Function<Object,? extends Tuple> tupleFactory)
Constructs a new cross table that transforms the cursor's data using the given column names as table dimensions. The given tuple aggregate is used for reducing the tuples to an object representing their features of interest an storing it in an instance of the specified data structure (acting as aggregation value). The given aggregate transforms an instance of the specified datastructure storing objects having the same values in the specified columns to a single object. This cursor has to perform nearly all of its computations inside the constructor (and not inside open), because the computation of the metadata already needs nearly the whole computation (the number of columns depends on the data).

Parameters:
cursor - the metadata cursor providing the input to be processed.
firstDimensionColumnName - the name of the column providing the first dimension of the cross table (the rows).
secondDimensionColumnName - the name of the column providing the second dimension of the cross table (from which the column values are taken).
tupleAggregate - an aggregation function that is called for every tuple of the input cursor. The aggregation function has to reduce the given tuple to an object representing the features of interest and returns an instance of the specified data structure storing this objects as aggregation value.
aggregate - a metadata function mapping instances of the specified datastructure storing objects having the same values in the specified columns to a single object. The relational metadata provided by this function defines the relational metadata of the columns given by the second dimension.
tupleFactory - a function that constructs a tuple out of a list of objects.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
The main method of this class showing a default use case.

Parameters:
args - the arguments to the use case. The arguments are optional and specify the name of the file containing the data, the name of the column defining the first dimension, the name of the column defining the second dimension, the name of the column tuples are reduced to before storing them into the internally used data structure, a boolean value specified whether the stored objects should be reduced to an average value or to the last object seen, a boolean value specifing whether the cross table should be printed to System.out or to a file, that's name is specified thereafter.
Throws:
Exception - if an exception occurs.
